comment.author: 22968943@N05
comment._content: It is remarkable - in all these LOC images from the 30's and 40's thusfar - CocaCola, occasionally RC Cola, but not a Pepsi to be seen.

comment.author: 10213344@N07
comment._content: This looks like the main entrance to the shops and to the right where there is a brick wall I think its now an open air flea market of sorts.  If this is from the perspective I am thinking of. Millions of people on cruise ships come through here now.

comment.author: 30139994@N07
comment._content: Beautifully preserved pic. Wow. It is the main entrance. On the left, further up where the pic is cut off is where the post office is now. On the right stands monuments of some our past educators of STT.  I can't believe how different main street looked back then.

comment.author: 15223455@N05
comment._content:
Hermosa postal del pasado,magnifica arquitectura de la ciudad,que tranquilidad y paz se aprecia en sus habitantes.
Felicitaciones,por pemitirnos conocer tan preciado tesoro.
¡¡ Gracias !!

comment.author: 41888259@N06
comment._content: It's a good possibility one of those ladies there could be a relative.

comment.author: 31775203@N03
comment._content: Nice view. You should consider sending it to www.roomswithgreatviews.com

comment.author: 34268127@N02
comment._content: The photos of St.Croix were extremely nice. Lived there for many years. The island still retains the character and charm of a place thrown back in time. That is why I travel there every 2 years.Plan to acquire the photos of the island in the near future.
